title: How to Plan a Clothes Swapping Party

steps.headline: Be sure you have clothes you want to get rid of.
steps.description: If you're not an adult, ask your parents' permission before planning your clothes swapping party. And don't swap anything without checking with them first.

steps.headline: Invite people.
steps.description: To make a clothes swapping party successful, you will need to invite at least 2-4 friends, the more the merrier.

steps.headline: Ask your friends to bring any bags, shoes, clothes, accessories etc that they are no longer to wear but still in good condition.
Make sure that you have plenty of mirrors so your friends can see how they look like.
If you have space, create a changing room where they can try things on.
If you have space to hang clothes up will be easier for them to look through them.
Sort the items into sections for them to look through them.
steps.description: Put all the tops together, jeans in one corner and so on.

steps.headline: Label each item with a number-you could use raffle tickets or make your own labels.
To keep things fair, give everyone a ticket for each item they can donate in which they can swap for a new item.
Give your guests a set time to look through and write down what they want/like.
steps.description: If more than one person wants the same thing,draw the name out of the hat.

steps.headline: If you have any unwanted items left at the end of your party, donate them to your local charity shop.
steps.description: And be sure to clean up any mess that is left.

text: Getting Started Be sure you have clothes you want to get rid of. If you're not an adult, ask your parents' permission before planning your clothes swapping party. And don't swap anything without checking with them first. Invite people. To make a clothes swapping party successful, you will need to invite at least 2-4 friends, the more the merrier. Ask your friends to bring any bags, shoes, clothes, accessories etc that they are no longer to wear but still in good condition.  Make sure that you have plenty of mirrors so your friends can see how they look like.  If you have space, create a changing room where they can try things on.  If you have space to hang clothes up will be easier for them to look through them.  Starting the Party Sort the items into sections for them to look through them. Put all the tops together, jeans in one corner and so on. Label each item with a number-you could use raffle tickets or make your own labels.  To keep things fair, give everyone a ticket for each item they can donate in which they can swap for a new item.  Give your guests a set time to look through and write down what they want/like. If more than one person wants the same thing,draw the name out of the hat. If you have any unwanted items left at the end of your party, donate them to your local charity shop. And be sure to clean up any mess that is left.
